thread.title: Florida rallies for soccer win over UT
thread.title_full: Florida rallies for soccer win over UT

title: Florida rallies for soccer win over UT
text:
Florida rallies for soccer win over UT News Sentinel staff 12:40 AM, Oct 10, 2015 Craig Bisacre/Tennessee Athletics Tennesseeâ€™s Meghan Flynn, right, goes up for the ball against Florida on Friday at Regal Soccer Stadium. Craig Bisacre/Tennessee Athletic Previous Next 
The Tennessee soccer team struck first, but gave up two unanswered goals in a 2-1 loss to Florida on Friday night at Regal Soccer Stadium that featured a long rain delay. 
Redshirt freshman Meghan Flynn scored her first goal of the season for the Vols (6-2-5, 2-2-2 SEC) in the 22nd minute on an assist from Mackenzie Gouner. 
Florida (9-3, 3-2) responded 33:21 into the first half on a goal by Brooke Sharp that was assisted by Rachelle Smith. It was Sharp's eighth goal of the season. 
The Gators took the lead for good on a score in the 42nd minute on a Liz Slattery goal that was assisted by Meg Dougherty Howard. 
Tennessee goalkeeper Julie Eckel made seven saves. It was only the second time this season Tennessee has given up more than one goal in a match. 
Freshman Rylie O'Keefe led the Vols with four shots, but Tennessee was outshot by Florida, 19-12. 
Women's Golf: Tennessee is tied for ninth at the Ruth's Chris Tar Heel Invitational, shooting an 11-over 299 in the first round at the UNC Finley Golf Course in Chapel Hill, N.C. 
UT is 14 strokes behind leader Duke. 
Shannon Brooks shot an even-par 72 and is tied for fifth in the individual standings. But she is the only Vol in the top 20. 
Blakesly Warren (74) is tied for 28th and Lucia Polo (76) is tied for 47th. Anna Newell and Emmie Pietila both shot 77 and are tied for 60th. 
Five teams in the 18-team field, including Tennessee, are ranked in Golfweek's top 25. 
Men's Golf: Tennessee shot an 11-over 299 and is tied for 11th after the opening round of the Bank of Tennessee Intercollegiate at Blackthorn Club in Jonesborough. 
The Vols are 10 strokes behind leaders Penn State, VCU and Virginia Tech. 
Chad Merzbacher was UT's top individual. He recorded four birdies on his last six holes to shoot a 72 and is tied for 11th. Juan Carlos Serrano is tied for 22nd at 73. Merzbacher and Serrano shot under par and finished in the top 20 in the tournament last year. 
Through two fall tournaments, Merzbacher and Serrano are tied for the team's best stroke average at 74.33. 
As for the other Vols, Jack Smith (74) is tied for 32nd, Mike Nagy (75) is tied for 42nd and Lorenzo Scalise (78) is tied for 64th. 
Men's Tennis: Tennessee's Preston Touliatos and Sunay Bhat picked up straight set wins at the 49ers Invitational at the Halton-Wagner Tennis Complex in Charlotte. 
Touliatos beat Francis Pare of Charlotte 6-3, 6-2, and Bhat defeated Presbyterian's Will Baird 7-6(3), 6-3. 
The four Vols at the weekend tournament played two rounds of doubles. Jack Schipanski and Marshall Sullivan pulled out the Vols one doubles win, beating a Presbyterian pair 6-4.
